sections.name: Venomfist
Spared From Death
sections.text: Venomfist was instrumental in helping Norgorber cross the chasm outside the Starstone Cathedral. In an ironic turn of events, Venomfist warned that the proposed plan could kill the then-very-mortal Norgorber. The man's response? “I don't care.” Even today, Venomfist doesn't know what desperation drove Norgorber to seek out the Starstone. As they never pried into Norgorber's past, motivations, or business, the god never felt the need to kill Venomfist after his ascension.

link.name: Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down pg. 88
link.alt: Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down pg. 88

sections.text:
Before he became a deity, Norgorber gained Venomfist's eternal service by giving the disgraced faydhaan shuyookh poisons to exact revenge upon those who stripped the genie of their status. The vengeance transformed Venomfist into what they are now, an outcome Norgorber cautioned of, yet one Venomfist doesn't regret.  
  
 Today in Duskfathom, Venomfist resides in the Sky Sea as the perfect defender of the unnamed islands. When summoned to other planes, only a part of them leaves while their main body remains behind. Venomfist's vivid green body is a testament to all the deals for poisons made with mortals and immortals alike over millennia.

link.name: Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down pg. 88
link.alt: Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down pg. 88

link.name: Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down pg. 88
link.alt: Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down pg. 88

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.text: An amphibious creature can breathe in water and in air, even outside of its preferred environment, usually indefinitely but at least for hours. These creatures often have a swim Speed. Their bludgeoning and slashing unarmed Strikes don’t take the usual –2 penalty for being underwater.

traits.name: Elemental
traits.text: Elementals are creatures directly tied to an element and native to the elemental planes. Elementals don’t need to breathe.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

traits.name: Water
traits.text:
Effects with the water trait either manipulate or conjure water. Those that manipulate water have no effect in an area without water. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of water or have a connection to magical water.  
  
Planes with this trait are mostly liquid. Visitors who can’t breathe water or reach an air pocket likely drown. The rules for aquatic combat aquatic combat usually apply, including the inability to cast fire spells or use actions with the fire trait. Creatures with a weakness to water take damage equal to double their weakness at the end of each round.

link.name: Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down pg. 88
link.alt: Pathfinder #206: Bring the House Down pg. 88

universal_monster_ability.name: Telepathy
universal_monster_ability.text: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

automatic_abilities.name: Toxic Downpour

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Primal
traits.text:
This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to primal magic.

automatic_abilities.text: Venomfist's presence alters the weather within 2 miles to heavy rainfall as long as they're located in a sizable body of water. When they become hostile, the rain in a 120-foot emanation from them becomes highly toxic and deals 8d8 poison damage (DC 42 basic Fortitude half) to all creatures in the area.

automatic_abilities.name: Vortex

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Water
traits.text:
Effects with the water trait either manipulate or conjure water. Those that manipulate water have no effect in an area without water. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of water or have a connection to magical water.  
  
Planes with this trait are mostly liquid. Visitors who can’t breathe water or reach an air pocket likely drown. The rules for aquatic combat aquatic combat usually apply, including the inability to cast fire spells or use actions with the fire trait. Creatures with a weakness to water take damage equal to double their weakness at the end of each round.

automatic_abilities.text: Water in the area that is in the same body of water as Venomfist is difficult terrain for Swimming creatures that don't have the water trait.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: This weapon can be used to attack enemies up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent enemies. For creatures with reach, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

universal_monster_ability.name: Constrict
universal_monster_ability.text: The monster deals the listed amount of damage to any number of creatures grabbed or restrained by it. Each of those creatures can attempt a basic Fortitude save with the listed DC.

ability.name: Create Poison
ability.effect: Venomfist transforms a portion of their watery body into a single dose of any type of common poison of 20th level or lower—tears of death is their favorite. If they're holding a container, they can create the poison within that container, at which point the poison remains viable for 24 hours before it reverts to water. Alternatively, they can apply a contact or injury-created poison to their fist.

ability.name: Surge
ability.text: Venomfist expands their space to fill the area of their vortex. Creatures within the aura take 6d12+6 bludgeoning damage and 6d12+6 poison damage with a DC 45 basic Fortitude save. A creature that fails this save is pushed 40 feet. Venomfist then retracts to their former space and cannot use Surge again for 1d4 rounds.
